III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4124 Communication.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a written policy regarding
Description communication that ensures that a child is able to communicate
with family and friends in a manner appropriate to the child’s
functioning and consistent with the child’s treatment plan and
security level.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed at the facility between 4/5/2022 - 10/25/2023. It
was reported that during this time, youth would have phone
contact with their adult brother who would make inappropriate
sexual comments and threats of sexual assault. When the facility
found out, they stopped the contact. Youth did not have any
access to a phone to contact her brother.
Investigation Interview:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on November 29,
2023, and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed by Carehouse Children’s
Assessment Center on November 28, 2023. Youth A frequently
talked with her head down making her difficult to understand and
she mumbled frequently. Youth A also at times appeared hesitant
to answer questions. Youth A reported she had ongoing contact
with her brother, and he talked to her sexually stating he would
“eat me out”, rape her again, and get her pregnant. Youth A
reported staff at Bay Pines heard him say this and he threatened
to beat her up for telling the staff about it. Youth A reported he
threatened to hurt her when she gets out and he will kill her
mother when she is adopted. Youth A reported when she was at
Bay Pines Center, she would use Therapist’s work iPhone and a
regular phone to Facetime, text, and talk to her bother. Youth A
reported she got into trouble with Bay Pines staff for showing her
brother her body in the mirror and was told to hang up the phone.
Youth A said her brother changed in front of her on facetime,
would show her his guns, watches, and said she should go out
with one of his friends. Youth A reported she was on the pod in
Bay Pines when this happened, and she reported it to Therapist
and her brother was taken off her contact list. Youth A denied
having visits with him while at Bay Pines Center.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on December 26,
2023. Therapist said Youth A was approved to have phone
contact with her brother when she arrived at Bay Pines Center.
Therapist said majority of these phone calls were supervised by
her and only a few calls were on the pod supervised by a staff
member. Therapist said Youth A called her brother about once per
2

week until August 2023, when he was removed from her phone
list. Therapist said the conversations she supervised between
Youth A and her brother were always appropriate and she never
had to end any calls early. Therapist said Youth A’s brother would
always redirect any negative conversation, encourage Youth A to
do positive things and work her treatment program. Therapist said
there was one conversation when Youth A told her brother he was
“acting rude” and he said “well then don’t call me anymore” which
Youth A interpreted as her brother did not want to talk to her
anymore and Therapist had to repeat what was said to help Youth
A understand that was not what he meant or was saying.
Therapist said Youth A would often hear things the way she
wanted to or would interrupt things incorrectly. Therapist said
Youth A reported to her that during a phone call that was
facilitated on the unit by staff, she said something to her brother
about an article of clothing and he showed her his boxer band that
was flannel. Therapist said this statement by Youth A then
morphed into Youth A disclosing her brother showed a body part
to her, then changed to her brother asking for sex. Therapist said
due to the concern for what was actually said and the phone calls
to Youth A’s brother becoming more problematic for Youth A than
positive it was decided to remove him from her call list. Therapist
said she had a phone conversation with Foster Care Worker who
agreed to suspend the contact with Youth A’s brother for the time.
Group Leader was interviewed via telephone on December
27, 2023. Group Leader said Youth A was on his unit and he
worked on her case. Group Leader said Youth A’s brother was on
her contact list until about August 2023. Group Leader said
originally Youth A was only allowed to have phone contact with
her brother in a “therapeutic setting” but eventually she was
allowed to have contact supervised by staff on the unit. Group
Leader said he supervised one call between Youth A and her
brother, and her brother was very encouraging to Youth A and told
her to make good choices and do well in the program so she could
move onto another placement. Group Leader said Youth A never
disclosed any concerns or inappropriate conversations that took
place between her and her brother. Group Leader said Youth A
began to make up scenarios after some of her calls which seems
to lead to them doing more harm than good for Youth A. Group
Leader said after some of the calls creating many behavioral and
emotional issues for Youth A the team decided to remove Youth
A’s brother from her call list. Group Leader said all calls are
logged on a contact list and staff are trained to end calls if they are
not positive for the youth.
3

Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
January 2, 2024. Foster Care Worker reported she has been
Youth A’s caseworker for over a year however was not at the time
of her placement at Bay Pines Center. Foster Care Worker said
when she took over the case Youth A was having approved phone
contact with her brother. Foster Care Worker said she had no
concerns about the phone contact between Youth A and her
brother until she was informed that Youth A reported to a Bay
Pines Center staff her brother was making inappropriate
statements during phone conversations. Foster Care Worker said
she talked to Therapist and Group Leader who stated they
suspended all contact between Youth A and her brother due to
Youth A’s report, and Foster Care Worker said she agreed that
the contact needed to be stopped. Foster Care Worker said Youth
A never told her about the inappropriate conversations. Foster
Care Worker said she had no concerns about the way in which
Bay Pines Center was handling Youth A’s phone contact with her
brother.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s contact list dated September 15, 2023. Youth
A’s contact list did not have her brother listed as of this
date. Therapist reported this is a fluid document that
changes each time a change is made by her or the youth’s
foster care worker.
• A review of social work contacts in MiSACWIS was
completed for May 15, 2023, until August 4, 2023. Youth A
contacted her brother on 5/15/2023, 5/21/2023, 5/27/2023,
5/28/2023, 6/1/2023, 6/28/2023, 7/1/2023, 7/5/2023,
8/4/2023.
• A social work contact in MiSACWIS dated August 4, 2023,
indicated Youth A’s disclosures of different versions of her
phone call with her brother that was potentially
inappropriate and therefore Therapist and Foster Care
worker agreed to suspend the phone contact with Youth
A’s brother.
• Juvenile Justice Residential Manual (JRM) Youth
Communication and Family Time policy was reviewed. The
policy outlines the expectations for youth to have a contact
list and the ability to have contact with those indicated on
the list in the manner that is approved.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Communication. Youth A
had an approved contact list and was allowed calls with her
brother, the facility suspended the calls once they became
detrimental to Youth A and Foster Care worker approved.
4

Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
